page.title: 02An Introduction To The Area.
page.content: The twelve square kilometres that are being covered in this 1985 Domesday Project are in the South Downs.The land is relatively undeveloped with many farms and fields.The main industries are arable,sheep and forestry.There are two main villages in this area,Singleton and W.Dean.There are several plantations, the major ones are Singletonhill, Whitedown and Warren Hanger, there is also an Arboretum and a Vineyard.The 'Trundle' tops the highest hill in the area,St.Roche's Hill.The hill's summit accomodates two disused radio masts and an observatory. The main road is the A286,which runs through West Dean,and East into Singleton.The River Lavant flows through the area and there is a Roman road which runs West of the villages.
